content.description: Awesome Boulder/Wall with red streaks of sand painting its face.  Three routes plus a traverse that moves up are here, all rated V3. One on the left, one in the middle that goes up the bulge (it's the hardest of the three, and Sh*t Stain Right, which you can do direct, or my favorite route, traverse from the bottom of Sh*t Stain Left, traverse right, and finish there.
content.location: This Boulder/Wall is about 50ft. NE(right) from Buddha Beads. Can't miss it as you will see Dirty Hole's gorgeous pockets and horn above and right of a cool dihedral and arete. Sh*t Stain get's its name from the red Sedona sand that is continually streaking the face of this rock.

content.description: Easy climb. Just use those feet and stay off the holds that are too easy.
content.location: Just beyond the old Midgley Bridge, down the wash. Two boulders look like a pair of dice, Rolled Dice is the larger of the two and appears to be on edge. Pick a side and send.

content.description: Big round boulder pocketed with holds.  Someone bolted it a couple of times with good reason because the landing is pretty bad.  I recommend bringing a rope to save you the insecurity.  The crux comes right in the middle of the climb when you move from a low pincher hold to a small neutral hold far right.  Find new routes and make this climb your own!
content.protection: TR this one for safety's sake.
content.location: From the old Midgely Bridge you'll hike down the wash about 400 feet. Located on the left side about 50 feet from the wash. Big, bold, and beautiful, you cant miss it.  There's a couple of anchors on the top of it to rope in on.

content.description: Continue slapping at the slope and look for good feet.
content.protection: Be sure to have a good spotter on this one. The climb traverses and could potentially lead to injury if you fall at the top.
content.location: Just to the left of JoJo's Rat Cave, same stone. You can connect the two climb for a long work out!

content.description: A super classic problem.  Begin under the amphitheater feature and move left through some easy moves before reaching the desperate exit around some super slopers.
content.location: Exit left out the bulge from under the roof.

content.description: Relatively easy climb once you get the heel deep. Fall right to a solid crimp then reach another crimp around the arete. Bump to the top and mantle 'er up.
content.location: From where the old Midgely Bridge used to be, this is the first small boulder located on your left. It overhanging and is shaped like South America.

content.description: The Sister of Shit Stain, this climb is really cool. Start in the dihedral, sitting down, and work up to the huge jug at the right. Get ballsy. don't fall!, and go up to the next left. Super juggy, easy top out.
content.protection: A Pad and I wouldn't do this one without a spotter.
content.location: Just to the right of Buddha Beads, next to Shit Stain. Beautiful black rock with what looks almost like a Crown at the top.

content.description: Toughest in the middle when you shoot up from the traverse with a right dyno, with your ass almost on the ground. EASY OUT.
content.protection: Almost safe even without a pad.
content.location: Along the bottom half of buddha beads, take the route from left to right, then up the obvious right face.

content.description: Perfect place to warm up. Excellent landing and three different climbs on one rock. Have fun!
content.location: The small trail the goes to the left of the main trails, where the Wilson Canyon sign lies, leads you straight to this climb. There's even a small string of beads that hangs on the tree next to the boulder. Bead donations accepted!

content.description: An easy sit start moves to two large neutral holds. Then a left to right gastant takes you a move away from a solid right crimp. A couple more small, committed moves, and you pull yourself over the top out.
content.protection: A pad or two and definitely a spotter.
content.location: Beautiful climb just to the left of a long amphitheater style stone. Left side of the wash when walking downward. Great spot to chill for lunch.

content.description: Named for the old fence materials scattered around, and for my efforts to do this problem as a rookie. This somewhat featureless looking problem houses some great crimps and a committed top out.
content.protection: A couple of pads will fit up there.
content.location: Directly across the wash from Shit Stain and Dirty Hole. It's a bit hidden behind another protruding rock. There is some old barbed wire bundled up back there too. Just jaunt your way up onto the bank and you can't miss it.

content.description: Start in the two pockets with the right and on the dime crimp with the left.  Play the arete with a heel for help and go for the high right hold.  Match it up, the top out is easy.
content.protection: A pad or two and a friend to cheer you on.
content.location: Just next door to shit stain, the dihedral is off limits. Absolutely beautiful stone.

content.description: Need something simple? Start with some baby steps, a sloper and a sidepull. Then just jug your way to the top.
content.protection: A Pad and Spotter to keep you from tumbling an extra 6 feet.
content.location: Located directly across the was from Orb Weaver and the Amphitheater. Up on the ledge to the left of the very appealing Crack Head.

content.description: Great area for all year round climbing! Shade spots in the hot summer, and bits of shelter for winter bouldering as well.
